name: Time Spent Shopping
helpText: Length of main shopping occasion

helpText: Which of the following items are you planning to buy in the next MONTH?

helpText: Which of the following items are you planning to buy in the next MONTH?

helpText: Womenswear / menswear products browsed (apparel)

name: Overall Behaviour:Products Purchased
helpText: Womenswear / menswear products purchased (of those browsed) - These are people that were successfully converted from product consideration to purchase

helpText: Womenswear / menswear products browsed (apparel)

name: Media Performance
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the level of excitement and attention around each retailer.

name: Advertising Awareness
helpText:
Those who have seen advertising for each retailer in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Have you seen ADVERTISING for any of the following retailers in the last month?

name: Positive Buzz
helpText:
Those who have heard something positive about each retailer in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers have you heard something POSITIVE about in the last month?

name: Negative Buzz
helpText:
Those who have heard something negative about each retailer in the last month (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers have you heard something NEGATIVE about in the last month?

name: Salience
helpText: Net buzz + Ad awareness

name: Net Buzz
helpText: The difference between positive and negative buzz

name: Buzz Noise
helpText: The total of positive and negative buzz

name: Spontaneous associations
helpText:
Thinking of the brand shown below, what associations come to mind?
Please write 1 or 2 word answers in the boxes below - the more interesting, the better!

name: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)
helpText: Measures charting the perceptions of brands' adherence to social responsibilities within their practices.

name: Most important CSR
helpText: Which of the following issues / initiatives are the most important when making a decision to purchase clothing, footwear or accessories?

name: Corporate Social Responsibility
helpText: Perceptions of whether or not a brand is acting responsibly with regards to it's practices

name: Inclusivity
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with being meant for people of all culture and races?

name: Transparency
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with offering transparency in how clothes are made?

name: Community
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with giving back to the community in some way?

name: Ethical labour
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with having ethical labour practices?

name: Environment
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with helping to protect the environment (e.g. by offering recycling services, using sustainable materials)?

name: Cause-driven
helpText: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers do you associate with not being afraid to support important causes?

name: Brand Health
helpText: Performance across the factors that capture the knowledge and affection for each retailer that can lead to purchase.

name: Top of Mind
helpText: Thinking about womenswear / menswear retailers, which names come to mind? - First mention

name: Spontaneous Awareness
helpText: Thinking about womenswear / menswear retailers, which names come to mind?

name: Prompted Awareness
helpText:
The awareness of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who don't state 'I do not know this brand').
Q: When, if ever, have you bought womenswear / menswear from the following retailer?

name: Familiarity
helpText:
The familiarity of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who don't state 'I do not have an opinion of this retailer').
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following womenswear / menswear retailers?

name: Affinity
helpText:
The affinity level of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the retailer and state they 'love' the retailer 'like it a lot' or 'like it a little bit').
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following womenswear / menswear retailers?

name: Appeal
helpText:
The affinity level of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the retailer and state they 'love' the retailer or 'like it a lot').
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following womenswear / menswear retailers?

name: Love
helpText:
The love for the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who are familiar with the retailer and state they 'love' the retailer).
Q: How would you describe your opinion of the following womenswear / menswear retailers?

name: Consideration
helpText:
The consideration of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Thinking about womenswear / menswear, which of the following retailers would you CONSIDER buying clothes, footwear and accessories from?

name: Preference
helpText:
The preference of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: And of the womenswear / menswear retailers you would consider, which would describe as your FAVOURITES?

name: Consideration & preference
helpText:
The consideration of the brands and the preference of the brands (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Please select all of the brands you would EVER CONSIDER  BUYING from / And of the brands you would consider buying from, which would describe as your FAVOURITES?

name: Never Consider
helpText: Which of the following retailers would you NEVER CONSIDER for buying clothes (womenswear / menswear)?

name: Demand & Usage
helpText: The visitation and usage of each retailer by channel on an annual and monthly basis.

name: Adoption Pyramid
helpText: A strategic map of how consumers perceive your product offer against pricing perception. Developed by Oliver Wyman, it identifies the important factors driving satisfaction.

name: Penetration (L12M)
helpText:
The penetration of the retailers over the last 12 months (stated as a percentage of all respondents who state 'PURCHASED - in the last 12 months').
Q: When, if ever, have you bought womenswear / menswear from the following retailer?

name: Ever Bought
helpText:
The penetration of the retailers over the last 12 months and beyond (stated as a percentage of all respondents who state 'PURCHASED - in the last 12 months' or 'PURCHASED - more than 12 months ago').
Q: When, if ever, have you bought womenswear / menswear from the following retailer?

name: Visited Overall (LM)
helpText: Visited the retailer in-store OR online in the last month

name: Bought Overall (LM)
helpText: Bought from the retailer in-store OR online in the last MONTH

name: Visited In-Store (LM)
helpText:
The in-store visitation of the retailers over the past 30 days (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers have you visited IN-STORE in the last month?

name: Bought In-Store (LM)
helpText:
The in-store penetration of the retailers over the past 30 days (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: From which of the following retailers have you BOUGHT womenswear / menswear IN-STORE in the last MONTH?

name: Conversion In-Store (LM)
helpText: % of those who visited IN-STORE who subsequently purchased

name: Purchase Frequency In-Store (L12M)
helpText: How many times have you PURCHASED womenswear / menswear from these retailers IN-STORE in the last year? (Among those who purchased any womenswear / menswear)

name: Spend In-Store (LM)
helpText: How much did you spend at each retailer IN-STORE in the last 3 months on womenswear / menswear?

name: Visited Online (LM)
helpText:
The online vistation of the retailers over the past 30 days (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: Which of the following womenswear / menswear retailers have you visited ONLINE in the last month?

name: Bought Online (LM)
helpText:
The online penetration of the retailers over the past 30 days (stated as a percentage of all respondents).
Q: From which of the following retailers have you BOUGHT womenswear / menswear ONLINE in the last MONTH?

name: Conversion Online (LM)
helpText: % of those who visited ONLINE who subsequently purchased

name: Spend Online (LM)
helpText: How much did you spend at each retailer ONLINE in the last 3 months on womenswear / menswear?

name: Purchase Frequency Online (L12M)
helpText: How many times have you PURCHASED womenswear / menswear from these retailers ONLINE in the last year? (Among those who purchased any womenswear / menswear)

name: Lost demand
helpText: The lost customer demand on an annual and monthly basis.

name: Lapsed (L12M)
helpText:
The level of lapsed customers of the retailers (stated as a percentage of all respondents who state 'PURCHASED - more than 12 months ago').
Q: When, if ever, have you bought womenswear / menswear from the following retailer?

name: Never Bought
helpText:
% of people who have never bought from the retailer (including those who are unaware).
Q: When, if ever, have you bought womenswear / menswear from the following retailer?

name: Customer Experience
helpText: The level of customer satisfaction and advocacy for the retailers.

name: Satisfaction In-Store
helpText: Q: Thinking about some of the retailers you have visited IN-STORE in the last 3 months, how would you rate your level of SATISFACTION with the retailer overall? (Scores 8 or above as a % of total)

name: Satisfaction Online
helpText: Q: Thinking about some of the retailers you have visited ONLINE in the last 3 months, how would you rate your level of SATISFACTION with the retailer overall? (Scores 8 or above as a % of total)

name: NPS
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the retailers by those have been customers in the last 3 months (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the womenswear / menswear retailers you have bought from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: NPS Segmentation
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the brands by those have been customers in the last 3 months (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the brands you have purchased from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?

name: Spend vs. expectations
helpText: Did you spend more or less than you expected to?

name: Spend more Reasons against expectations
helpText: Why did you spend more than expected?

name: Spend less Reasons against expectations
helpText: Why did you spend less than expected?

name: Price perception matrix
helpText: A comparison of the price of last purchase vs. whether the customer thought the purchase was more costly than they had initially expected

name: Experience Profiling
helpText: How satisfied the customer was with the service they received

name: Proximity - Brand Meets My Needs
helpText:
Percentage of those asked who gave a rating of 8 - 10 (out of 0 - 10) for each brand when thinking about how the brand meets the respondents' needs
Q: When shopping for womens clothing, footwear and accessories how well do the following meet your needs?

name: Proximity - Brand For Me
helpText:
Percentage of those asked who gave a rating of 8 - 10 (out of 0 - 10) for each brand when thinking about how much they agree with the statement "This brand is for me"
Q: For the brand below, how much do you agree with the statement "This brand is a brand for me"

name: Brands I Must Visit for Denim

name: Compare metrics
helpText: An interface for comparing multiple metrics

name: NPS (Aware)
helpText:
The level of advocacy for the retailers by those who are aware of the retailer (stated as a Net Promoter Score - the 'percentage of promoters' minus the 'percentage of detractors').
Q: Considering the womenswear / menswear retailers you have bought from, on a scale of 0-10 how likely would you be to recommend them to friends / family?
comments: SET TO LIVE ON SPECIFIC CLIENT REQUEST

name: Promoters (Aware)
helpText: The % of Promoters (rating 9-10) among those who those who are aware of the retailer.
comments: SET TO LIVE ON SPECIFIC CLIENT REQUEST

name: Detractors (Aware)
helpText: The % of Detractors (rating 0-6) among those who those who are aware of the retailer.
comments: SET TO LIVE ON SPECIFIC CLIENT REQUEST

name: Passives (Aware)
helpText: The % of Passives (rating 7-8) among those who those who are aware of the retailer.
